p: IFN-α is contraindicated in patients with abnormal liver function. In children with creatinine clearance (CrCl) below 50 mL/min, IFN-α is prohibited. IFN-α is also contraindicated in children with histories of mental illness, severe or unstable heart disease, or aplastic anemia. IFN-α nebulization should be used with caution in neonates and infants younger than 2 months [ 10]. Adverse reactions of IFN-α mainly include low-grade fever and flu-like symptoms (both in children with intramuscularly injection) [ 11]. Growth and development inhibition is more common when combining IFN-α with ribavirin. Suicidal ideation is more common in children (mainly adolescents) compared with adults (2.4% vs. 1%) [ 12]. To our knowledge, IFN-α has few drug interactions. However, IFN-α should be used with caution while combining with sleeping pills and sedatives.
